body: It *wasn't* until this year for some reason. As someone who lives in a relatively conservative circle, I can say a few maybe felt uncomfortable around lgbts and sometimes acted weary of black strangers (not for racist reasons, but because of how they commit more crime and violence which they acknowledged was due to social factors and not connected to race) but that was it. They were otherwise true to their principles, limited government and constitutionalism and "rugged individualism" as it's sometimes called. Free speech, gun rights, religious freedom, free markets, etc. But apparently this year they've suddenly flipped their position and now they *do* seem to be going in a fascist direction, ironically similar to their worst enemies, the liberals. I'm not sure what prompted this but it's scary how quickly people can get out of control. A similar event happened with the millenials, who unbelievably used to be libertarians.
body_html: It wasn't until this year for some reason. As someone who lives in a relatively conservative circle, I can say a few maybe felt uncomfortable around lgbts and sometimes acted weary of black strangers (not for racist reasons, but because of how they commit more crime and violence which they acknowledged was due to social factors and not connected to race) but that was it. They were otherwise true to their principles, limited government and constitutionalism and "rugged individualism" as it's sometimes called. Free speech, gun rights, religious freedom, free markets, etc. But apparently this year they've suddenly flipped their position and now they do seem to be going in a fascist direction, ironically similar to their worst enemies, the liberals. I'm not sure what prompted this but it's scary how quickly people can get out of control. A similar event happened with the millenials, who unbelievably used to be libertarians.
